answerText: Pamela, or Virtue Rewarded[10] Samuel Richardson's Pamela was satirized in this man's Shamela. He also wrote a novel about the brother of Pamela who is repeatedly hit on by Lady Booby, entitled Joseph Andrews.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 3 | 13 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: At one point in this novel, the title character realizes with horror that the housekeeper Mrs. Jewkes might be an atheist because she is so unwomanly. For 10 points each: [10]  Identify this epistolary novel about a girl enslaved by the nobleman Mr. B. The title character's virtue is rewarded because she falls in love with Mr B as he keeps forcing himself on her.
